title: Abyssal tentacle

properties.name: description
properties.value: The abyssal tentacle is a weapon which requires 75 Attack to wield. It is created by combining a kraken tentacle with an abyssal whip. It is an upgraded variant of the whip, having a +8 increase in Slash and +4 increase in Strength over its predecessor. It also has a 25% chance per hit to poison the opponent, which starts at 4 damage. With regard to one-handed weapons, the +90 slash bonus of the abyssal tentacle is second only to the +94 slash bonus of the Blade of Saeldor. It is very popular in the Duel Arena along with the Ghrazi rapier.

content:
This article is about the weapon. For the item required to make the weapon, see Kraken tentacle.
Abyssal tentacle
Released10 April 2014 (Update)
MembersYes
Quest itemNo
Properties
TradeableNo
EquipableYes

OptionsWield, Check
Worn optionsCheck
DestroyDissolve This will dissolve your whip immediately. The whip will be permanently lost.
ExamineA weapon from the Abyss, embedded in a slimy tentacle.

Weight0.453 kg
Advanced data
Item ID12006

The abyssal tentacle is a weapon which requires 75 Attack to wield. It is created by combining a kraken tentacle with an abyssal whip. It is an upgraded variant of the whip, having a +8 increase in Slash and +4 increase in Strength over its predecessor. It also has a 25% chance per hit to poison the opponent, which starts at 4 damage. With regard to one-handed weapons, the +90 slash bonus of the abyssal tentacle is second only to the +94 slash bonus of the Blade of Saeldor. It is very popular in the Duel Arena along with the Ghrazi rapier.

The abyssal tentacle can be created by using a kraken tentacle on an abyssal whip. Once created, the weapon will degrade after 10,000 hits, consuming the whip and leaving only the tentacle. When using the items on each other there will be a warning message that states The tentacle will gradually consume your whip and destroy it. You won't be able to get the whip out again. The combined item is not tradeable.

If the abyssal tentacle is not protected upon death, it will fully degrade into a kraken tentacle. However, if it is protected on death, it will remain in its regular state as the abyssal tentacle. In addition, the abyssal tentacle does not stack in the bank, regardless of the number of charges the abyssal tentacles have.

Using a Shattered relics variety ornament kit on an abyssal tentacle will change its appearance into that of an abyssal tentacle (or).

Degradation[edit | edit source]

A player attaches a kraken tentacle to an abyssal whip.

Due to the volatile nature of the kraken tentacle, the abyssal tentacle degrades as it is used. Each hit costs 232.52, costing up to 348,785.25 per hour. After 10,000 hits with the weapon (400 minutes of continuous combat), it will degrade and consume the abyssal whip, leaving the player with only the kraken tentacle. If the player has a full inventory, the kraken tentacle will be left equipped in the weapon slot, useless and invisible.

As of an update on 31 March 2016, players can combine the charges of two abyssal tentacles. One fully charged abyssal tentacle is worth 10,000 charges, but by adding additional abyssal tentacles (not kraken tentacles), it can reach a maximum of 20,000 charges. This action will destroy the other abyssal tentacle, making this action effectively cost a kraken tentacle as well. This feature can be very useful in PvM situations, where players may use hundreds of charges through several boss fights.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performs the abyssal tentacle's special attack, Binding Tentacle.

The abyssal tentacle has a special attack, Binding Tentacle, which consumes 50% of the player's special attack energy. Regardless of whether the hit is successful, the target will be bound for 5 seconds, and there will be approximately a 50% chance of applying poison, starting at 4 damage.

Poison damage[edit | edit source]

Total Poison damage (D) is calculated by the sum of all numbers (n) up to the max hit (M), times the amount of hits per number (H=5).

D ( M ) = H ⋅ ∑ n = 1 M n = H ⋅ 1 2 M ( M + 1 ) = 2.5 ⋅ 4 ( 4 + 1 ) = 50 {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}D(M)&=H\cdot \sum _{n=1}^{M}n=H\cdot {\frac {1}{2}}M(M+1)=2.5\cdot 4(4+1)=50\end{aligned}}}

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 March 2022
(update)

The item's examine text was changed; previously, it was "A weapon from the abyss, embedded in a slimy tentacle."

31 March 2016
(update | poll)

It is now possible to combine the charges of two abyssal tentacles up to 20,000 charges.

3 September 2015
(update)

The abyssal tentacle will no longer lose charges on a free-to-play world.

[[File:Abyssal tentacle detail.png|130px|left]]
The '''abyssal tentacle''' is a [[weapon]] which requires 75 [[Attack]] to wield. It is created by combining a [[kraken tentacle]] with an [[abyssal whip]]. It is an upgraded variant of the whip, having a +8 increase in Slash and +4 increase in Strength over its predecessor. It also has a 25% chance per hit to [[poison]] the opponent, which starts at 4 damage. With regard to one-handed weapons, the +90 slash bonus of the abyssal tentacle is second only to the +94 slash bonus of the [[Blade of Saeldor]]. It is very popular in the [[Duel Arena]] along with the [[Ghrazi rapier]].

The abyssal tentacle can be created by using a [[kraken tentacle]] on an [[abyssal whip]]. Once created, the weapon will degrade after 10,000 hits, consuming the whip and leaving only the tentacle. When using the items on each other there will be a warning message that states ''The tentacle will gradually consume your whip and destroy it. You won't be able to get the whip out again. The combined item is not tradeable.''

If the abyssal tentacle is '''not''' protected upon [[death]], it will fully [[degrade]] into a kraken tentacle. However, if it is protected on death, it will remain in its regular state as the abyssal tentacle. In addition, the abyssal tentacle does not stack in the bank, regardless of the number of charges the abyssal tentacles have.

Using a [[Shattered relics variety ornament kit]] on an abyssal tentacle will change its appearance into that of an [[abyssal tentacle (or)]].

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Abyssal tentacle}}

==Degradation==
[[File:Attaching kraken tentacle.gif|frame|right|A player attaches a kraken tentacle to an abyssal whip.]]
Due to the volatile nature of the kraken tentacle, the abyssal tentacle degrades as it is used. Each hit costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Abyssal whip|0.0001}}}}, costing up to {{Coins|{{GEP|Abyssal whip|0.15}}}} per hour. After 10,000 hits with the weapon (400 minutes of continuous combat), it will degrade and consume the abyssal whip, leaving the player with only the kraken tentacle. If the player has a full inventory, the kraken tentacle will be left equipped in the weapon slot, useless and invisible.

As of [[Update:Bugfixes & Combining Tentacles|an update]] on [[31 March]] [[2016]], players can combine the charges of two abyssal tentacles. One fully charged abyssal tentacle is worth 10,000 charges, but by adding additional abyssal tentacles (not kraken tentacles), it can reach a maximum of 20,000 charges. This action will destroy the other abyssal tentacle, making this action effectively cost a kraken tentacle as well. This feature can be very useful in [[Player versus monster|PvM]] situations, where players may use hundreds of charges through several boss fights.

==Special attack==
[[File:Binding Tentacle.gif|thumb|right|220px|A player performs the abyssal tentacle's special attack, ''Binding Tentacle''.]]
The abyssal tentacle has a [[special attack]], ''Binding Tentacle'', which consumes 50% of the player's special attack energy. Regardless of whether the hit is [[successful hit|successful]], the target will be bound for 5 seconds, and there will be approximately a 50% chance of applying poison, starting at 4 damage.

==Poison damage==
Total Poison damage (D) is calculated by the sum of all numbers (n) up to the max hit (M), times the amount of hits per number (H=5).

<math>\begin{align}
D(M) &= H\cdot\sum_{n=1}^{M}n = H\cdot\frac{1}{2}M(M+1) = 2.5 \cdot 4(4+1) = 50
\end{align}</math>
